required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Combination of Aerobic and Resistive Exercise on Activities of Daily Living and Risk of Fall in Osteosarcopenic Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of combination of aerobic and resistive exercise on activities of daily living and risk of fall in osteosarcopenic patients

detailed_description.textblock:
After being informed about the study and potential risk, all patients giving written informed consent will undergo study entry.
to begin with: assessment with bioelectrical body composition analyzer and first exercise and assessment clinical scales
1th month: assessment with bioelectrical body composition analyzer and assessment clinical scales 3th month: assessment with bioelectrical body composition analyzer and assessment clinical scales

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Female and male patients over 70 years of age followed-up from osteoporosis outpatient clinic

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Skeletal Muscle Mass Measurement at month 3
primary_outcome.description: Assessment with bioelectrical body composition analyzer male: SMI<9,2 kg/m2 female: SMI<7,4 kg/m2

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Skeletal Muscle Mass Measurement at month 1
primary_outcome.description: Assessment with bioelectrical body composition analyzer male: SMI<9,2 kg/m2 female: SMI<7,4 kg/m2

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Katz Activities of Daily Living Scale at month 3
Change from Baseline on Katz Activities of Daily Living Scale at month 1
Change from Baseline on Short Physical Performance Battery at month 3
Change from Baseline on Short Physical Performance Battery at month 1
Change from Baseline on Berg Balance Test at month 3
primary_outcome.description: maximum 56 point, a score of < 45 indicates individuals may be at greater risk of falling.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Berg Balance Test at month 1
primary_outcome.description: maximum 56 point, a score of < 45 indicates individuals may be at greater risk of falling.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Timed Up and Go Test at month 3
primary_outcome.description: Stand up and walk 3 meters, turn around, walks back to the chair and sit down.14 seconds or longer : high risk for falling

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Timed Up and Go Test at month 1
primary_outcome.description: Stand up and walk 3 meters, turn around, walks back to the chair and sit down.14 seconds or longer : high risk for falling

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on Five Times Sit to Stand Test at month 3
Change from Baseline on Five Times Sit to Stand Test at month 1

arm_group.description: Female and male patients over 70 years of age with osteoporosis and sarcopenia

intervention.description: the combination of aerobic and resistive exercise, three time a week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 70 years of age
- Clinical diagnosis of osteoporosis or osteopenia
- Independent mobilization
- Walking speed < 0.8 m / sec
- Grip strength < 20 kg for women, < 30 kg for men
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure> 200 mmHg, diastolic blood pressure> 110 mmHg)
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
- Stroke, hip fracture, knee and hip arthroplasty, spinal surgery in the last 6 months
- Severe cardiac arrhythmia
- Myocardial infarction in the last 6 months
- Severe dementia and difficulties in cooperation
- Cardiac pacemaker
- Dialysis
- Acute infection
- Severe edema
- Malignancy patients
- Severe anemia (Hgb <8 mg / dl)

overall_official.affiliation: Şişli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

facility.name: Şişli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sisli Hamidiye Etfal Training and Research Hospital
